Sentencas: In this paper, strategies for biogas reforming and their ensuing effects on solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) performance are explored.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Synthesized biogas (65% CH4 + 35% CO2) fuel streams are reformed over a rhodium catalyst supported on a porous alpha-alumina foam.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Reforming approaches include steam reforming and catalytic partial oxidation (CPOX) utilizing either air or pure oxygen as the oxidant.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A computational model is developed and utilized to guide the specification of reforming conditions that maximize both CH4 and CO2 conversions.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Model predictions are validated with experimental measurements over a wide range of biogas-reforming conditions.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Higher reforming temperatures are shown to activate the biogas-borne CO2 to enable significant methane dry-reforming chemistry.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Dry reforming minimizes the oxidant-addition needs for effective biogas conversion, potentially decreasing the thermal requirements for reactant heating and improving system efficiency.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Such high-temperature reforming conditions are prevalent during CPOX with a pure-O-2 oxidant.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: While CPOX-with-O-2 reforming is highly exothermic, the endothermicity of dry-reforming chemistry can be exploited to ensure that catalyst temperatures do not reach levels which cause catalyst sintering and degradation.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: SOFC electrochemical performance under biogas reformate is shown to vary substantially with reforming approach.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Cell operation under CPOX-with-O-2 reformate is found to be comparable to that under humidified hydrogen.
Titulo: Biogas fuel reforming for solid oxide fuel cells
